id: College student detained after wearing real ammunition as part of Halloween costume
paragraph: A student at the University of Central Florida (UCF) was detained after wearing a “Terminator” Halloween costume complete with real ammunition.UCF Chief of Police Carl Metzger told Fox News that the 20-year-old student's costume consisted of a large leather jacket and a bandolier of live gunshot shells."While it's not illegal to have ammunition on campus, it certainly is in poor taste given the events of the past week," Metzger said, according to Fox News.THIS was the costume that was being worn by the person in Classroom I today.Friendly advice from UCFPD:Do NOT incorporate simulated or ACTUAL ammunition/weapons into your costumes. It scares others & puts safety at risk. If you see suspicious activity, call 911 immediately. pic.twitter.com/cqkLdKRxrOA deadly shooting on Saturday at a synagogue in Pittsburgh left 11 dead just days after a Florida man mailed more than a dozen packages with pipe bombs to CNN and prominent Democrats.Metzger said the student seemed surprised that the costume caused a stir and that “there was no ill intent on this student’s part.”Metzger added that the costume idea was “not the smartest thing to do.”The police chief said his department received one phone call regarding the costume but expected to get more.The student was later released after police questioned him.
